subject: Leadership
title: Team Norms and Agreements
description: Learn Team Norms and Agreements in one minute.

hook.text: One team always starts meetings on time. Another is always late. Nobody decided eitherâ€”it just happened.

buildup.text: Norms are unwritten rules that shape behavior. They form whether leaders create them intentionally or not.

discovery.text: Explicit norms outperform implicit ones. When teams agree on behaviors openly, accountability becomes easier.

twist.text: The hardest norms to change are the ones nobody talks about. Silence around norms is itself a powerful norm.

climax.text: Effective teams revisit norms regularly. As context changes, old agreements can become barriers to progress.

punchline.text: Unspoken norms run the team. Spoken ones let the team run.

quiz.question: Why are explicit norms more effective than implicit ones?
